an9.21:4.1: “The humans of Uttarakuru surpass the gods of the Thirty-three and the humans of India in three particulars.
an9.21:4.3: They’re selfless and not possessive. They have a fixed life span. They have a distinctive nature.
an9.21:4.4: The humans of Uttarakuru surpass the gods of the Thirty-three and the humans of India in these three particulars.
an9.21:5.1: The gods of the Thirty-three surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and India in three particulars.
an9.21:5.3: Divine life span, beauty, and happiness.
an9.21:5.4: The gods of the Thirty-three surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and India in these three particulars.
an9.21:6.1: The humans of India surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and the gods of the Thirty-three in three particulars.
an9.21:6.3: Bravery, mindfulness, and the spiritual life is lived here.
an9.21:6.4: The humans of India surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and the gods of the Thirty-three in these three particulars.
